maml:description.maml:para: Denies a user or an IIS app pool access to a certificate's private key.
This will explicitly block access to a certificate's private key file, in case you want to test a user or app pool's dependence on it, or aggressively protect it.

maml:Description.maml:para: A certificate from the Windows Certificate Store.
The name of an IIS app pool.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
A Windows domain account.
A certificate from the Windows Certificate Store.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The name of an IIS app pool.
A certificate from the Windows Certificate Store.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
A Windows domain account.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Denies the ExampleAppPool app pool access to read the cert in $cert.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Find-Certificate.ps1 -FindValue ExampleCert -FindType FindBySubjectName -StoreName TrustedPeople -StoreLocation LocalMachine |Block-CertificateAccess.ps1 ExampleAppPool

dev:remarks.maml:para: Denies the ExampleAppPool app pool access to read the found ExampleCert.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the Archived property on a certificate.
Setting the Archived property allows you to disable a certificate without deleting it, for software that excludes Archived certificates.

maml:Description.maml:para: The certificate to archive.
The certificate to archive.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets $cert.Archived to $true.
Sets the found ExampleCert as archived.
For more information about options for -FindType: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.security.cryptography.x509certificates.x509findtype.aspx
Sets the certificate as archived.

maml:description.maml:para: Unsets the Archived property on a certificate.
Clearing the Archived property allows you to enable a certificate without having to re-import it, for software that excludes Archived certificates.

maml:Description.maml:para: The certificate to un-archive.
The certificate to un-archive.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets $cert.Archived to $false.
Sets the found ExampleCert as not archived.
For more information about options for -FindType: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.security.cryptography.x509certificates.x509findtype.aspx
Sets the certificate as not archived.

maml:description.maml:para: Searches a certificate store for certificates.
Searches for certificates in the Windows Certificate Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: The value to search for, usually a string.

For a FindType of FindByTimeValid, FindByTimeNotYetValid, or FindByTimeExpired, the FindValue must be a datetime. For a FindType of FindByApplicationPolicy or FindByCertificatePolicy, the FindValue can be a string or a System.Security.Cryptography.Oid. For a FindType of FindByKeyUsage, the FindValue can be a string or an int bitmask.
The field of the certificate to compare to FindValue. e.g. FindBySubjectName, FindByKeyUsage, FindByIssuerDistinguishedName

For a FindType of FindByTimeValid, FindByTimeNotYetValid, or FindByTimeExpired, the FindValue should be a datetime. For a FindType of FindByApplicationPolicy or FindByCertificatePolicy, the FindValue can be a string or a System.Security.Cryptography.Oid. For a FindType of FindByKeyUsage, the FindValue can be a string or an int bitmask.
Omitting a FindType or StoreName will search all stores and common fields.
The name of the certificate store to search. e.g. My, TrustedPeople, Root
Omitting a FindType or StoreName will search all stores and common fields.
Whether to search the certificates of the CurrentUser or the LocalMachine.
Whether to further filter search results by checking the effective and expiration dates.
Whether to further filter search results by excluding certificates marked as archived.
Whether to throw an error if a certificate is not found.
The value to search for, usually a string.

For a FindType of FindByTimeValid, FindByTimeNotYetValid, or FindByTimeExpired, the FindValue must be a datetime. For a FindType of FindByApplicationPolicy or FindByCertificatePolicy, the FindValue can be a string or a System.Security.Cryptography.Oid. For a FindType of FindByKeyUsage, the FindValue can be a string or an int bitmask.
The field of the certificate to compare to FindValue. e.g. FindBySubjectName, FindByKeyUsage, FindByIssuerDistinguishedName

For a FindType of FindByTimeValid, FindByTimeNotYetValid, or FindByTimeExpired, the FindValue should be a datetime. For a FindType of FindByApplicationPolicy or FindByCertificatePolicy, the FindValue can be a string or a System.Security.Cryptography.Oid. For a FindType of FindByKeyUsage, the FindValue can be a string or an int bitmask.
Omitting a FindType or StoreName will search all stores and common fields.
The name of the certificate store to search. e.g. My, TrustedPeople, Root
Omitting a FindType or StoreName will search all stores and common fields.
Whether to search the certificates of the CurrentUser or the LocalMachine.
Whether to further filter search results by checking the effective and expiration dates.
Whether to further filter search results by excluding certificates marked as archived.
Whether to throw an error if a certificate is not found.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Find-Certificate.ps1 -FindValue ExampleCert -FindType FindBySubjectName -StoreName TrustedPeople -StoreLocation LocalMachine

dev:remarks.maml:para: Searches Cert:\LocalMachine\TrustedPeople for a certificate with a subject name of "ExampleCert".
Uses positional parameters to search Cert:\LocalMachine\TrustedPeople for a cert with subject of "ExampleCert".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Find-Certificate.ps1 -FindValue ExampleCert -FindType FindBySubjectName -StoreName TrustedPeople -StoreLocation LocalMachine |Grant-CertificateAccess.ps1 ExampleAppPool

dev:remarks.maml:para: Allows the ExampleAppPool app pool access to read the found ExampleCert.

maml:navigationLink.maml:linkText: .net - winhttpcertcfg giving access to IIS user in Windows 7 - Stack Overflow

maml:description.maml:para: Revokes a user or an IIS app pool access to a certificate's private key.
This will remove access to a certificate's private key file.

maml:Description.maml:para: A certificate from the Windows Certificate Store.
The name of an IIS app pool.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

A Windows domain account.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Revokes the ExampleAppPool app pool access to read the cert in $cert.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Find-Certificate.ps1 -FindValue ExampleCert -FindType FindBySubjectName -StoreName TrustedPeople -StoreLocation LocalMachine |Revoke-CertificateAccess.ps1 ExampleAppPool

dev:remarks.maml:para: Revokes the ExampleAppPool app pool access to read the found ExampleCert.

maml:description.maml:para: Rescinds a denied user or an IIS app pool access to a certificate's private key.
This will rescind denied access to a certificate's private key file.

maml:Description.maml:para: A certificate from the Windows Certificate Store.
The name of an IIS app pool.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
A Windows domain account.
A certificate from the Windows Certificate Store.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The name of an IIS app pool.
A certificate from the Windows Certificate Store.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
A Windows domain account.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Revokes the denied ExampleAppPool app pool access to read the cert in $cert.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Find-Certificate.ps1 -FindValue ExampleCert -FindType FindBySubjectName -StoreName TrustedPeople -StoreLocation LocalMachine |Unblock-CertificateAccess.ps1 ExampleAppPool

dev:remarks.maml:para: Revokes the denied ExampleAppPool app pool access to read the found ExampleCert.
